text:
I was just thinking, you know, maybe we
should renew our vows.

You know, have, like, a whole ceremony here
on the bluff.
I don't love it.
You don't? I super love it.
Really?
How great is this gonna be?
We'll invite all our friends, our family.
We'll get it catered.
We'll have someone playing the flute.
Hey, I can finally get my monkey.
What's that, baby?

Remember at our wedding, I always wanted to
have a monkey walk down the aisle and hand me
the ring.
Yeah.

Yeah. No reason you can't have your monkey
this time.
Sweet.
How can I help you?

Oh, okay. Uh, well, my wife and I were
renewing our vows, and we need to rent some
chairs and tables and stuff.
Here's the date. There's the time.

Now, do I need to leave you a deposit, or
are you.
First things first.
What kind of chairs did you want?
Uh.
Kind you, uh, sit on.
We offer 11 different styles.
Flat back, arched, faux bamboo.

I'm obliged to also mention beanbag chairs,
but I forbid you.
Sit down and I'll go get our catalog.
Okay.
The Beastie Boy.
Oh, that's my monkey guy.
Hello. Hey.
So we, uh, we're good to go on the 18th.

What? Well, can't Fleischman Toyota have
their going Bananas sale without him?
Okay, fine.

Um, so I guess we'll go with that spider
monkey.
Oh, my God, I'm so sorry.
Okay, then. Thanks.
I can't believe this. I can't get my monkey.
Oh. Can't you?
Well, maybe I'm not available now.
All right. No, no, I'll do it.
I'll do it.

Yes. Hi. I'm looking for Maria Ferraro, the
flutist.
This is she, the flutist?
Hey, potato, potato, right?
It's flutist.

Right. Anyway, um, my husband and I were
thinking about hiring you for our vow

renewal, and I was just wondering if I could
hear you play a little something.
Well, the phone isn't really the best medium.
For either flute or get off the pot.
Okay. Would you just hold on?
Hold on for one second. Okay.
Hello? Miss?
be right back.
Hello?
Hi, darling.

I was just thinking, instead of that stodgy
old port wine, how about if I float you a
delightful bottle of peach schnapps?
Nearly full.

Dad, I kind of had my heart set on trying the
port.
Aha. What about if I throw in a canned ham?

All right, I got to go. I'll talk to you
later.
Hello?
Hey, I need you to decide on a table.

They have round, oval, square, rectangle,
one in that stop sign shape.
I'm on the other line right now, honey.
Listen, I am very close to blacking out.
Please pick a shape.
I am on the other line with the flute lady.
Would you wait a second? I got to go.
I'll talk to you at home. I got it back.
That sounded great.
Hello? Are you still there?
Where are you?

I think the more appropriate question is,
where were you?
Oh, um. I'm sorry.
You see what happened? Oh.
This party.
Are all flutists, bitches?
Because I know three of them are.
And the bakery won't deliver to the bluff.

So we got to drive 25 miles with a four foot
high cake strapped to her hood.
And porta-potties are a fortune.

Can't we just tell everybody on the
invitation to come having peed?
What's the matter with you?
Mr. Bongo's a whore.

He blew us off because he got a job working
at Toyota dealership with Phil Simms.
I'm sorry, baby.

Who would have thought that a beautiful
thing like a vow renewal would be such a pain
in the ass.
I know. But you're still into it, right?
Yeah. I mean, if you are.
Well, I
am. Willing not to, though, if you.
Okay. Really? Yeah.

Oh, my God, I am so relieved we are killing
ourselves here.
Yes. Oh, I'm so happy we're not doing this.
What were we thinking? I know.
I mean, we already did our vows.
We said them
once. They never go bad.
They're like Twinkies, right?

Don't mind me just dropping off some
literature.
